title: Option to Customize From Address is not always available
content:
I just upgraded to v115.5.0

When I compose an email message, I can select the "Customize From Address..." on the menu for the from address. If I reply to a message that was sent to an existing identity, I have the option to "Customize From Address..." on the menu for the from address. When I reply to a message sent to one of my extended email addresses, the option to "Customize From Address..." is on the menu, but disabled. Prior to version 115.5.0 this worked and I was able to customize the from address when replying to a message sent to an email address that did not match an existing identity. I use extended email addressing, so I need the option to customize the from address -- is there some way to enable this option again?
creator: moseley-mozilla

title: message from Thunderbird when trying to access account "may have too many cached connections, use IMAP Advanced Settings to reduce cached
content:
After clicking the Thunderbird to enter my email the whole system goes through connecte3d to uepat624@gmail.com then up comes a message from Thunderbird indicating "you may have too many cached connections use IMAP Advanced Settings to reduce cached connections" Then things continue on for probably 5 to 10 mins. sending login info, looking up IMAP, checking mail server capabilities, looking for folders, sending login, opening folder box, downloading

Eventually email inbox and messages come up. I can send, receive and send mass mailings but when you read a message and want to go back to the inbox you have to scroll all the little boxes at the top of the screen back to the one that says "inbox".

I need someone to remove the cached connections. Pat Blackburn
creator: uepat624

title: Provisioning Calendars with different IDs
content:
Hello there,

I know it is possible to provision user settings over the .js files in /defaults/prefs. However, I would like to configure the "Prefer client side email scheduling" options over this file. For that I would have to input the exact ID of the calendar, which is not possible due to a big amount of users. I also looked up wild cards (like calendar.registry.*.forceEmailScheduling) but unfortunately they do not work.

Is there any other way to achieve configuring specific calendars with certain options, like the one I described?


Kind regards, Alex

title: Lightning not showing iCal reminders
content:
I am running Ubuntu 22.04 and Thunderbird 115.4.1 (64-bit).

I am a long time user of both Ubuntu and TB.

For years, I have had calendars working with TB (& Lightning).

I use a number of sources, but I am trying to slowly migrate to having one set on my phone and computer, which means using iCal.

This has worked seamlessly for years, but it now isn't working on my main laptop.

I have had to set up the iCal calendars twice, as one implementation allows me to setup an event, but won't show it, and the other shows the event, but won't let me set it up.

Both ways are configured as R/W.

That is painful, but almost tolerable, but the main issue is that the iCal calendars don't show any reminders.

On the phone, they are visible, and enabled and work.

Other calendars (not iCal) seem to work OK - but that isn't fully tested.

I used the route to set up the calendars as described in https://frightanic.com/apple-mac/thunderbird-icloud-calendar-sync/ - and didn't use any scripts but configured them manually.

There are three iCal calendars (I have no idea why, but ...)

I have named the three calendars on the computer e.g. CalA1, CalA2 and CalA3 - and the "duplicate" ones CalB1, CalB2, CalB3.

One thing I have puzzled over, is that the "server number" between the "CalAx" and "CalBx" are different, but constant within CalAs and CalBx.

I tried setting up a new instance, but Lightning would not allow me, even though the URLs were different.

However, CalAx all allow me to set events including reminders, but doesn't display them.

All CalBx won't allow me to set up or edit events (providing an error on saving).

In both instances, the calendars are enabled, and are set to be R/W.

My ideal would be to have either CalAx or CalBx working with reminders - so it is less confusing for me! But it is the reminders that is my greatest bugbear!

Any help would be most appreciated.

Many thanks,
creator: trevortmanson

title: Thunderbird appears to halt Windows 11 print spooler
content:
New install on a friend's HP laptop. Thunderbird was setup with profile imported from older laptop running Windows 10. Printer is an HP Smart Tank Plus 655.

Printing works fine on other apps such as Word, browsers, notepad, Acrobat. Start up Thunderbird and can successfully print one document, but subsequent attempts at printing from Tbird show 'Print as PDF' and no other print options in the print dialog box. Attempting to print via other apps produces same result.

Restarting print spooler works temporarily. Other fixes found on forums such as the 'remove addons.json from profile folder' fix dont work.

Have also reinstalled Thunderbird, checked spooler settings, reinstalled printer drivers, with no resolution. Interestingly, I installed Thunderbird on another windows 11 laptop, with a new profile and following Thunderbird's email account setup wizard and I have no printing issues.

Could this be related to importing the old profile across to Windows 11? Or are there other issues at play?

Thanks.
creator: Krusty865

title: Unified SENT Folder Not Picking Up Messages
content:
My unified folders are properly picking up e-mails from my account except for the SENT unified folder. The unified SENT folder is empty. I've checked the Properties settings, and they are correct (the same setup as the other unified folders which are working). I've attached a view to illustrate the problem. As can be seen from the attachment, the account's SENT folder has 121MB of message data while the unified folder is empty. Also shown is that the account's SENT folder has been selected in the unified folder Properties settings which should bring in the account's 121MB of data in it's SENT folder, which it apparently doesn't do for some reason.

Any suggestions to correct the problem would be welcome.

Regards, JS
creator: James-A

title: Message Indexing - Indexing 6,416 of 28,169 messages in the Sent folder (22%)
content: Rebuilding the database for the inbox and sent messages does not work. Message is being indexed - it always hangs in the same place: Indexing 6,416 of 28,169 messages in the Sent folder (22%) The process stops and does not go any further. The inbox won't rebuild at all. How to check the logs and on which message the process stops? There is space on the disk. I can't roll back the version because I have the beta version (the new one stopped working and only the beta version worked properly). Antivirus also disabled. All sqlite files were deleted (moved) but it didn't help.

title: Collapsed thread does not show unread messages
content:
In Thunderbird 115.5.0 (64-bit) when you have collapsed threads enabled I have seen the software indicate there are say 8 unread messages. There are no bolded messages in the message panel. If you click on the READ status column you still can not see the unread messages. The only way is to uncollapse the threads and scroll down the message pane to see the bolded messages in each thread. Why?

If the threads are collapsed how are we supposed to find unread messages?

title: partial migration of email account to new laptop... issues with IMAP
content: Hello and thanks in advance to anyone offering help, very much appreciated. My partner hates computers but has to deal with them for her home based work. After long struggle she has got to grips and enjoys the functionality of Thunderbird. Her old laptop is on the way out and we got her a new upgraded machine (Lenovo windows 11). a 'friend' tried to solve a problem in the past and created a second account locally on her laptop that mirrors the incoming emails to her main BTinternet mail account. however, sometning went wrong and she hasd over 15000 duplicated emails on the second back up account. We wish to istall Thunderbird on her new machine as she doesn't like to windows mail app and noy 'enjoys' (sic) the thunderbird, especially coulering emails for easy reference. we were told that if she deletes the second account, all of the mirrorede emails on the desired/to keep BT account will also be lost. we are now wondering if it is possible to download Thunderbird onto the new machine and somehow not import the unwanted account when she signs in etc. We are hoping also that when she downloads and installs and signs in.... (the above query accepted) that her folders will also import and be populated. But!... only for the account she wants. i hope this has been clear? The server is imap from BTinternet email thnaks to all who read this far
creator: stepphen1

title: While the display size is correct on my MacBook Pro 2021 screen is OK, it is huge and unusable on my second monitor
content:
Hello, While the display size is correct on my MacBook Pro 2021 screen is OK, it is huge and unusable on my second monitor (see images). My layout.css.devPixelsPerPx is set at 2.5. If I set it at default (-1), the external monitor display is OK, but the internal monitor is so small that it is unreadable (to the extend that it was actually hard to figure out how to revert back to so I moved the window to the external monitor). This is a bug. There should be a setting per monitor or the default should follow the System Preferences setting for all monitors.

Please fix this quickly!

Thank you, Alain Damlamian p.s.: I tried to upload two pdf images but they were refused (why only accept jpg ?)
creator: Alain_Damlamian

title: Message body display font change
content:
Hello good people,

Used Thunderbird for a couple of years now with one small issue, that is the font size contained within message body after sending - basically the preview pane.

every now and then I have a go at finding the setting, the closest I have come to resolving this is to select 'message body, then plain text or simple HTML' whilst this does work it doesn't feel as though this is the way it should be changed, it also has tendency to jump back to 'original HTML'

Ages ago when I first started using Thunderbird a helpful user directed me to the CSS file for font changes to the main view, this worked well and haven't needed to change it since, I did try to find this style sheet again but the option appears to have been removed with the new version of Thunderbird, which btw, is great - thank you !

Currently using Version 115.4.2 (64-bit) on Win 10 Pro
